column1: A fungus (plural: fungi) is a kind of living organism: yeasts
column2: moulds and mushrooms are types of fungi. The fungi are a separate kingdom of living things
column3: different from animals and plants.Fungi have cells with nuclei. Their cell walls contain chitin
column4: unlike the cell walls of plants
column5: which contain cellulose. These and other differences show that the fungi form a single group of related organisms
column6: called the Eumycota or Eumycetes. They share a common ancestor and are monophyletic group.Their basic mode of life is saprophytic: a fungus breaks down dead organic matter around it
column7: and uses it as food.Fungi reproduce both sexually and asexually. Some fungi grow mushrooms: these are fruiting bodies. Under the cap there are gills; the gills bear spores that will disperse
column8: and may develop into new fungi. Otherwise
column9: fungi use a sporangium to bear asexual spores by mitosis
column10: or sexual spores by meiosis. The spores are haploid.
